rename.from: Migrations bug when createing stored procedure with GOTO statement
rename.to: Migrations bug when creating stored procedure with GOTO statement

body:
Hi @brandonryan 

Thanks for creating the issue, we are facing the same issue. In our case, the command with the "GOTO" contains a stored procedure, which is not called by the application. For a test I commented this migration out and I had another migration with the same problem, but this one doesn't contain a "GOTO".

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/assets/1005903/34954738-6105-472d-9b17-5fe68e46f81e)

It looks like, that EF splits the query on every "go" -> like the "**go**to" keyword or the column name "**Go**odsDirection".

issue.title: Fix splitting migrations SQL by GO

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.title: MigrationBuilder.Sql truncating sql string...

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
This appears to be a change in behavior from EF Core 7.0.0 and 8.0.0. For some migrations I read a SQL file off disk and send the content string through MigrationBuilder.Sql. This has always worked fine for years and after this upgrade I started getting syntax errors from old migrations. I drilled into the stack trace and inspected the CommandText in RelationalCommand.ExecuteNonQuery() and found that my SQL string is being truncated by the library. I commented out this failing part of the migration to let it run further just and noticed once it got to another migration doing the same thing that that migration had also truncated its Sql string, but in a different spot, it didn't seem to be based on the length of the string at all, which is weird. My SQL files aren't doing anything very complex, a table variable, populating it, doing inserts and updates. I'm going to try and reproduce the problem on a standalone project and will provide it when I have it done.

EDIT: After further research, it appears to be truncating the SQL string after it finds a line starting with the value "Go". The following SQL appears to be truncated for example. If I surround the column name "GoId" with brackets, it doesn't truncate the string. I'm guessing it is doing some parsing on the sql string for the "go" keyword and just dumping the rest of it or
 something? I've attached the solution/project reproducing this issue, you can reproduce it by running the migration db update command. If you want the debugging/stack trace you'll need to do some extra steps to call migrations from the code instead.

[EFBug.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/files/13604963/EFBug.zip)

```Sql
declare @t table (
    GoId nvarchar(500)
)
insert into @t
select ''
```

### Include your code

```C#
var text = File.ReadAllText(Path.Join(Directory.GetCurrentDirectory(), "Migrations", "<MySqlFileName>.sql"));
            
migrationBuilder.Sql(text);
```

### Include stack traces

Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlException (0x80131904): Incorrect syntax near ','.
   at Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection.OnError(SqlException exception, Boolean breakConnection, Action`1 wrapCloseInAction)
   at Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlInternalConnection.OnError(SqlException exception, Boolean breakConnection, Action`1 wrapCloseInAction)
   at Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.TdsParser.ThrowExceptionAndWarning(TdsParserStateObject stateObj, Boolean callerHasConnectionLock, Boolean asyncClose)
   at Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.TdsParser.TryRun(RunBehavior runBehavior, SqlCommand cmdHandler, SqlDataReader dataStream, BulkCopySimpleResultSet bulkCopyHandler, TdsParserStateObject stateObj, Boolean& dataReady)
   at Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand.RunExecuteNonQueryTds(String methodName, Boolean isAsync, Int32 timeout, Boolean asyncWrite)
   at Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand.InternalExecuteNonQuery(TaskCompletionSource`1 completion, Boolean sendToPipe, Int32 timeout, Boolean& usedCache, Boolean asyncWrite, Boolean inRetry, String methodName)
   at Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand.ExecuteNonQuery()
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.RelationalCommand.ExecuteNonQuery(RelationalCommandParameterObject parameterObject)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Migrations.MigrationCommand.ExecuteNonQuery(IRelationalConnection connection, IReadOnlyDictionary`2 parameterValues)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Migrations.Internal.MigrationCommandExecutor.ExecuteNonQuery(IEnumerable`1 migrationCommands, IRelationalConnection connection)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Migrations.Internal.Migrator.Migrate(String targetMigration)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.RelationalDatabaseFacadeExtensions.Migrate(DatabaseFacade databaseFacade)

### Include provider and version information

EF Core version: 8.0.0
Database provider: (e.g. Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer) SqlServer
Target framework: (e.g. .NET 6.0) .NET 8.0
Operating system: Windows
IDE: (e.g. Visual Studio 2022 17.4) Rider 2023.3

issue.title: [release/8.0] Fix splitting migrations SQL by GO

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Fixes #32457
Port of #32548

### Description

The code for parsing migrations SQL (never comes from user input) was updated to remove a regex, but this resulted in a parsing error.

### Customer impact

Truncated SQL when executing raw SQL commands in migrations.

### How found

Customer reports on 8.0.

### Regression

Yes.

### Testing

Added test case.

### Risk

Low and quirked.

body:
I can still reproduce this in 8.0.6. Example script in `migrationBuilder.Sql`

```
SELECT
    ColumnA,
    ColumnB,
    GoodColumn,
    ColumnC
FROM 
   Table
```

Is truncated before executing to
```
SELECT
    ColumnA,
    ColumnB,
```
And fails with `Incorrect syntax near ','`

If I change to:
```
SELECT
    ColumnA,
    ColumnB,
    [GoodColumn],
    ColumnC
FROM 
   Table
```

It works. I presume it looks for lines starting with `go`?

issue.title: SQL truncated at lines starting with "go" in migrationBuilder.Sql

issue.body:
## File a bug
I can still reproduce #32457 in v8.0.6

Example script in `migrationBuilder.Sql`
```
SELECT
    ColumnA,
    ColumnB,
    GoodColumn,
    ColumnC
FROM 
   Table
```

Is truncated before executing to
```
SELECT
    ColumnA,
    ColumnB,
```
And fails with `Incorrect syntax near ','`

If I change to:
```
SELECT
    ColumnA,
    ColumnB,
    [GoodColumn],
    ColumnC
FROM 
   Table
```

It works. I presume it looks for lines starting with `go`?

### Include provider and version information

EF Core version: 8.0.6
Database provider: (e.g. Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer)
Target framework: .NET 8
Operating system: Windows
IDE: Latest Visual Studio and Rider.
